cab.content: 20.10.19.NOTE BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE. FOR THE COLONIES *I fhivk my colleagues should see the attached copy of a telegram which I have received from the govern or General of South Africa, Personally I know nothing of any such Agreement, although I am of opinion that consultation is in principle desirable.(Initialled) K. PARAPHRASE TELEGRAM from the Governor General of the Union of South Africa to the Secretary of State for the Colonies.(Received Colonial Office 11.45 p.m. 18th October, 1919)October 16th. Private and Personal. General Smuts ' and I have lately had occasion in view of my vacation of Office next June to discuss question of my successor from the general point of view.I think it well to let you know in order that there will be no possible misunderstanding that General Smuts is quite clear in his own mind that it was agreed that in- each case of the appointment of a Governor General the Prime Minister of the Dominion should be consulted before the appointment was offered to anyone and that the consultation should not merely be ?formal.BUXTON.
